ei 1.3.4

Summarize Ecological Inference Estimates

summary.ei.Rd

`summary' method for the class `ei'.

# S3 method for ei
summary(object, ...)

Arguments

object

An ei object from the function ei.
...

A list of options to return in graphs. See values below.

Value

TODO

References

Gary King (1997). A Solution to the Ecological Inference Problem. Princeton: Princeton University Press.

Author

Gary King <<email: king@harvard.edu>> and Molly Roberts <<email: molly.e.roberts@gmail.com>>

Examples


data(sample_ei)
formula <- t ~ x
dbuf <- ei(formula = formula, total = "n", data = sample_ei)
#> 
i Running 2x2 ei

#> 
                 

#> i Maximizing likelihood
#> i Running 2x2 ei

#> 
v Running 2x2 ei [235ms]

#> 
#> 
\ Beginning importance sampling.

#> 
v Beginning importance sampling. [1.4s]

#> 
print(summary(dbuf))
#> $Erho
#> [1] 0.5
#> 
#> $Esigma
#> [1] 0.5
#> 
#> $Ebeta
#> [1] 0.5
#> 
#> $N
#> [1] 75
#> 
#> $Resamp
#> [1] 16
#> 
#> $`Maximum likelihood results in scale of estimation (and se's)`
#>         Bb0       Bw0       sigB       sigW       rho Zb0 Zw0
#>  -1.1534919 0.8217156 -2.2861904 -1.8819733 0.4123728   0   0
#>   0.1009835 0.1017592  0.2487998  0.1575466 0.3652448   0   0
#> 
#> $`Untruncated psi's`
#>         BB        BW        SB        SW       RHO
#>  0.1949226 0.7295063 0.1088302 0.1596047 0.3325368
#> 
#> $`Truncated psi's (ultimate scale)`
#>        BB        BW         SB        SW       RHO
#>  0.200978 0.7156594 0.09834917 0.1423378 0.2806014
#> 
#> $`Aggregate Bounds`
#>            betab     betaw
#> lower 0.09549504 0.3979843
#> upper 0.60893461 0.8031228
#> 
#> $`Estimates of Aggregate Quantities of Interest`
#>         mean          sd
#> Bb 0.2016883 0.011181990
#> Bw 0.7193291 0.008823345
#> 
#> $precision
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "summary"
